summary: The Pythagorean theorem is a math rule about right triangles. It says that if you square the length of the longest side (hypotenuse), it equals the sum of the squares of the other two sides. This theorem is named after the Greek mathematician Pythagoras. Many people have proven it in different ways. You can use this theorem to find distances on a grid, and it also works in higher dimensions and other types of spaces.
title: Pythagorean theorem
